title: Front Desk Overbooks the Schedule
summary: The schedule is double-booked for multiple high-production procedures. Address the operational error without shaming; build scheduling protocol clarity.

scene.setting: The schedule is double-booked for multiple high-production procedures. You realize the day cannot run smoothly. You feel stress and unsupported; the hidden risk is publicly criticizing the front desk.

beats.narration: The double-book is discovered. The decision point is whether to react in front of the team or regroup privately.

dialogue.speaker: lead
dialogue.line: We have two high-production slots at the same time. We need to fix this without blaming anyone in front of the team.

choices.label: Call out the problem in front of the team and ask who did the booking.

steps.step: Debrief privately with front desk lead; agree one protocol change.

leader_lines: Who can walk me through how this happened?
questions: What block rule would prevent this?
scripts.closing_line: One rule from today: we fix in private.

choices.label: Regroup privately with the front desk lead and fix the day together.

steps.step: Meet privately with lead; fix the day together.
Define one protocol (block rules or daily review).

leader_lines: Let's fix the day together. What do you need?
questions: What protocol would prevent this next time?
scripts.closing_line: You own the fix; I support.

choices.label: Take the heat yourself and tell the team you'll manage; discuss later.

steps.step: Shield the team now; same-day private debrief with lead.

leader_lines: I'll manage today. We'll debrief after.
questions: When can we meet privately to close the loop?

choices.label: Ignore it and work through the chaos; avoid conflict.

steps.step: Within 24h, name the issue without blame; set one rule.

questions: What one change would reduce chaos next time?

system_prompts.nudge: Private accountability builds systems, not fear.
system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you fix the day or fix the system?

outcomes.message: Two weeks later, another booking error. Errors may be going unreported.
reflection_questions: What would have changed if you had regrouped privately first?
How do you build psychological safety for reporting?

outcomes.message: The lead owns the protocol. Fewer double-books; trust preserved.
reflection_questions: Which single protocol made the difference?
How did you reinforce without shaming?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week we addressed errors without blame. (1-5)
